59501.name: After Lovecraft: The Cold Case of Robert Suydam
59501.description:
From the back of the book:

You'll Never Read Lovecraft the Same Way Again...

Ten years ago, the sinister forces at work in Brooklyn's Red Hook neighborhood coalesced in the events described in the short story: "The Horror at Red Hook." The abductions, child sacrifices, and public downfall of the previously reclusive and well-respected Robert Suydam were big news at the time, but a decade later those demonic events are nearly forgotten. Only two living people know what really happened that night in Red Hook when devils and demons walked the Earth--an agoraphobic retired police detective named Malone and a very special young girl who wasn't even born when the events took place.

H. P. Lovecraft's imagination has terrified and entertained millions since his stories were first published nearly a century ago. As the inspiration for the Call of Cthulhu roleplaying game, Lovecraft's work has inspired countless hours of game play for investigators and Keepers around the world. Few of those adventures have directly engaged Lovecraft's stories themselves, but those that have offer an extra thrill--a bit of majesty borrowed from the master. The After Lovecraft line of adventures seeks to offer players and Keepers scenarios that directly build upon Lovecraft's tales, where the investigators themselves read Lovecraft's stories in game, as part of the adventure itself.

After Lovecraft: The Cold Case of Robert Suydam contains everything a Call of Cthulhu group needs for a few evenings of Mythos-inspired fun, including pre-generated characters and the entire text of Lovecraft's short story "The Horror at Red Hook." It is the latest in the innovative line of officially licensed Call of Cthulhu scenarios and supplements from Super Genius Games.

59502.name: The Big Night
59502.description:
Publisher Blurb: The Big Night is a cooperative storytelling game with puppets to cut out and color. Together, the players will tell a story about a group of stuffed animals, snowmen, and other creatures, who help out the Fat Man to deliver presents to children on the Big Night.
The Big Night is a very simple game. It can be played by anyone who loves stories, but it is designed especially for young children. This game uses no dice, and no numbers higher than 3. At least one player in the group must be able to read the book, but their younger brothers, sisters, and friends will be able to enjoy it also.

59503.name: Was werde ich?
59503.description:
There are 20 profession tiles in the game. Each player gets a device on his/her forehead, with another player putting in a tile, so no player knows his/her profession.
A spinner is spun and points to a choice of three yes/no questions, of which the player asks one (answered by the other players). The first player to find out three professions is the winner.

59506.name: Psionics Toolkit
59506.description:
From the back of the book

You've got your Psionics rulebook. Your players have their characters rolled up. You've picked out your first adventure. Now what?

The Psionics Toolkit provides you with resources and tools needed to incorporate psionic powers into your fantasy campaign. Whether you're starting as lst-level psions or you've just finished defeating the dark elf queen in her fortress with your 13th-level paladin, the Psionics Tookit has something for everyone!

Featuring new psionic monsters (including a Psionic Dragon), interesting psionic characters, new prestige classes (including the Beastmaster), a new cleric domain, new organizations, new magic items, the Psionics Toolkit contains all of the "crunchy bits" you'll need to expand your campaign.

A sourcebook for integrating and expanding psionics in your campaign.

But, more importantly, the Psionics Toolkit contains IDEAS. Plot hooks, adventure ideas, character backgrounds and motivations, methods for developing psionics in existing characters, as well as an extensive checklist of questions to ask yourself when adding the power of the mind to your fantasy world.

59507.description: The game consists of 72 wooden disks in 6 colors and 6 sizes. At first, players take turns piling up "towers" (pyramid shaped). In the second phase, the players try to build towers that only contain disks in their own color. Whoever manages that first is the winner.
59507.name: Das Göttinger Turmspiel

59508.name: Andromeda
59508.description:
There are two games playable with this material (a square board, 11 x 11, and a number of playing pieces). In the actual "Andromeda", players try to tow enemy spaceships to their own bases, the movements determined by dice rolls.
In "Starship Alpha 11", players try to encircle a starship. This ship, however, can jump around the board on a roll of 1.

59509.name: Al'Anfa und der tiefe Süden
59509.description:
Translated from the back of the box:
Al'Anfa, the city of lavishness of debauchery and vice, focus of the slave and drug trade - it was about time that Aventuriens most infamous city was studied and described for players and DMs. In this box you will find the phantastic, gaudy description of a background in front of which any kind of adventure can unfold itself, for not only the sinister Al'Anfa is presented by the skilled authors but as well the impenetreble jungles with their partly charming partly bloodthirtsty inhabitants as well as the manifold world of the southern islands with their corrupt governors the daring yet ruthless pirates and the woodmen with their bizarre rites...

If you are searching for that kind of adventure stuff that will make your players sweat and sends cold shivers down their spines then step into the deadly world of southern Aventurien.

Contents:
Exhaustive description of Aventuriens south in 2 books.
1 book 'Under pirates', a collection of short adventures, DM tips and scenarios themed around the pirates of the south.
1 big coulored city map of Al'Anfa.
4 large format maps of the region.

59510.name: Rascals, Rogues, Rapscallions, and Renegades
59510.description:
User summary:
Encounter tables for use with the Pandora's Dice Wheel product, allowing for generation of random villainous NPCs for use with any fantasy RPG. Introduced at a "Bulldog" Comic Con in Dallas, Texas in 1989, as a companion to the Pandora's Dice Wheel.

59511.name: Im Labyrinth der Gefahren: Die Gefangenen des Minotaurus
59511.description:
User description:

Adventure for the RPG 'Der Geheimbund des Schwarzen Auges'. The module is about the ancient story of Theseus and the minotaur. The characters are sent out to correct the story in the mythic book which has been changed. So the heroes have to best the labyrinth and many foes of ancient greek mythology.

59512.name: Fantasy Adventure Encounter Cards
59512.description:
From the cover:

For Use With All Fantasy Role Playing Games!

56 Different Encounter Cards to be cut up and used with your Fantasy Gaming Adventures.

Sample Cards:
Treasure #7: A Crown Worthy of a King
This golden crown is bejeweled in an array of stunning rubies and emeralds set in patterns which resemble the stars in the night sky. The inside is lined with padded velvet and seems a comfortable fit no matter who wears it.

Magical Weapon #8: Neptune's Trident
This trident is enhanced with an accuracy spell for throwing. It rolls 3XD6 as a hand weapon and 5XD6 when thrown. It seeks vital spots on an enemy with 78% accuracy and has magically enhanced armor penetrating ability up to and including plate mail.

59513.name: Puladnas
59513.description: Puladnas is a trick-taking game unlike any other trick-taking game. For one thing, it isn't the highest-valued card that takes the trick. It's the card closest to 7 that takes the trick. Secondly, players may beg to change the trump suit, but there are pros and cons to both begging and granting or denying a beg. After a few plays, you start to learn some good strategies and may even learn to be rather ruthless in your quest to gather cards that score well together. So, try a change from the old with Puladnas.

59514.name: Árnyékháború
boardgamepodcastepisode: RJ30: Shopping victorious
59514.description:
This game is based on the Hungarian rpg M.A.G.U.S. The cards represent aristocrats, the suits represent the 5 provinces of the country.

Árnyékháború is a fairly simple card game with some twists. The goal is to make the largest network of alliances. An alliance is a straight, or (at least) three-of-a-kind. You can add a card face down as a secret supporter (or a betrayer if it doesn't fit). Every card has a type: sorcerer, warrior or influential lady. There are also event cards that help you destroy alliances.

This self-contained game is not to be confused with Árnyékháború, one of many expansion sets for the collectible card game Kiválasztottak, a M.A.G.U.S. kártyajáték. Both are based on the world of the M.A.G.U.S. rpg.

59515.name: push&move
59515.description: In push&move, a board game for 2 - 4 players, each player has a set of five dice with which he or she tries to push at least 3 of an opponent’s dice over the edge of the playing field or onto one of the dreaded "death-tiles" in order to win. Each and every time you play, the playing field can be assembled individually and randomly from a varity of tiles with special effects by throwing a 20-sided die.

59516.name: Sturmbringer
59516.description:
User summary

The Sturmbringer box is the German version of the 3rd edition Stormbringer rules. The box contains four books that include translated and reorganized versions of the Stormbringer main rulebook, the Stormbringer Companion, and the Demon Magic supplement, as well as some new material.

Contained herein are:

character creation rules
task resolution and combat rules
the magic system
setting information
a bestiary
an A3 monochrome map of the Young Kingdoms

59517.name: 44: A Game of Automatic Fear
rpghonor: 2009 Indie RPG Awards - Best Free Game - Runner Up
2009 Indie RPG Awards - Best Production - Runner Up
2010 Golden Geek Best Free RPG Nominee
59517.description:
From the Publisher's Website:

"Someone you know was just replaced by a machine. No one else knows. You are next. Human or machine? You don't know who to trust. Confront the conspiracy before your time runs out."

44: A Game of Automatic Fear is a suspense and horror role-playing game designed for single sessions with very little preparation required. It's a great game for busy players looking for a one-shot session.

User Summary:

44: A Game of Automatic Fear is a totally free and downloadable game from the creator of Dust Devils.

59518.name: Vigil Watch: Warrens of the Ratmen
59518.description:
From the back of the book:

Lurkers in Shadow

The Ratmen - or, as they call themselves, the slitheren - are some of the deadliest foes adventurers can face: foul humanoid rodents, intent on spreading evil throughout the lands of men, elves, and dwarves. In the dank reaches of the Mourning Marshes, the many broods of ratmen have come together in a profane alliance, intent on mayhem and the downfall of all other races.

Vigil Watch: Warrens of the Ratmen: includes a wealth of information about the ratmen, their culture, society, and biology. Here, you will read of their diabolical plots and schemes, of the twisted monsters that lurk in the deadly marshlands. Here, too, is information on new broods of slitheren - the sorcerous Black Pelts, the powerful Storm Chasers, the cunning Forge Crawlers, and the enigmatic Unseeing, as well as rules for developing slitheren as player characters. Two detailed ratman settlements come ready made for adventuring.

Join the Struggle - meet the slitheren and their minions face to face. And pray that you live to tell the tale.

59519.name: Vigil Watch: Secrets of the Asaatthi
59519.description:
From the back of the book:

Feared Warriors of the Arcane

Cold. Cunning. Masters of sword and spell. Such words describe the serpent-folk known as the asaatthi, yet still little is known of their ancient history, their rich culture, their once-influential role in the world and their plans for the future.

The second volume in the Vigil Watch series for the Scarred Lands, this sourcebook explores the mysterious asaatthi race -- their creation in the Epoch of Mormo, the rise and fall of their culture and their future goals. Also discover tips for using these serpent-folk in any d20 campaign, from the creatures' lairs and tactics to unique magic and prestige classes.

59520.name: The Serpent & the Scepter
59520.description:
From the back of the book:

The Cycle Continues

Armed with the lore gained from ancient ruins, the heroes venture forth once again - this time to discover the True Ritual that will allow them to destroy the unwholesome Serpent Amphora and its contents. This may prove more difficult than anticipated, however, for the dead harbor many secrets.. and they are often loathe to give them up.

Useable alone or as part of the ongoing Serpent Amphora Cycle - which begins with "The Serpent Amphora," a free adventure available for download at www.swordsorcery.com - The serpent & The Scepter is an adventure for characters of 4th - 5th level.

59521.name: The Serpent Citadel
59521.description:
From the back of the book:

The Cycle Concludes

A ritual gone horribly awry leads to a pursuit through the warped Hornsaw Forest, where the Serpent Mother herself was torn asunder. With nothing but their own might and the assistance of some unlikely allies, the heroes must recover a lost treasure and somehow stop the machinations of Mormo's children, lest they resurrect the dread titan.

Usable alone, or as a part of the ongoing Serpent Amphora Cycle - which begins with "The Serpent Amphora," a free adventure available at www.swordsorcery.com - The Serpent Citadel is an adventure for characters of 6th -7th level.

59522.name: The Serpent Amphora
59522.description:
User summary:

The Serpent Amphora is a free d20 System adventure that starts the Serpent Amphora Cycle.

The player characters are entrusted with an amphora and have to defend it against followers of Mormo.

59523.name: OVA: Open Versatile Anime Role-Playing Game
59523.description:
Publisher description:

The OVA Role-Playing Game has all the rules you need to recreate those diverse worlds of Japanese animation you've grown to love. From inventing your own fictional persona to becoming part of the adventure, all you need is a few friends and you're ready to go! Features the easy-to-use Ricochet rule system. Statless character creation allows you to make the character you want, and the unique dice mechanic keeps the action fast and fun. Don't just watch the anime. Live it!


Easy Yet Versatile


The Ricochet mechanics are accessible to anyone. Not needlessly complicated or dummied down, complete beginners and die-hard gamers can play side by side.


Create Your Perfect Character


OVA's unique statless character creation system makes getting started a breeze. Open-ended rules make anything possible, and creating characters is as simple as describing them.


Entertaining and Lavishly Illustrated


Rules are punctuated with detailed examples and artwork featuring colorful, recurring characters. Over 60 illustrations by some of today's most talented anime-style artists.


Anything is Possible


Whether you want to fight evil as a transforming magical beauty, defend Earth against alien attackers, compete in ancient fighting tournaments, or simply survive campus life, OVA can make it possible. If you can dream it, you can do it!"

59524.name: Das Weltenbuch
59524.description:
User summary

Das Weltenbuch is the rulebook for the German RPG of the same name.

It includes:

campaign background information
character creation and advancement rules
task resolution and combat rules
the magic system
GM advice
a short introductory adventure

59525.name: Usagi Yojimbo
59525.description:
From the back of the book:

Experience the Adventure for Yourself...

Inspired by the critically-acclaimed, Eisner-award winning comic-book series, the USAGI YOJIMBO Role-Playing Game brings you the mystery, wonder, and glory of feudal Japan. While the warring states have been brought to peace under the watchful eyes of the Shogun, danger still abounds in the form of greedy bandits, scheming warlords, and even supernatural horror. But a house that heaps evil upon evil cannot stand...

More than just a source-book for the Usagi characters and stories, this game stands apart as a combination of story-telling and role-playing. Start simple, then add more skills, powers, and abilities — even trade in old ones for new as your character changes and grows to become the hero that you create. Take on the role of a brave samurai warrior, a sly ninja, a wise priest, or even a simple farmer bound for glory. Battle the forces of corruption, despair, and evil. Clash swords with dozens of foes, or duel a single worthy opponent — simple rules combine with your character's special abilities to make all encounters quick, decisive, and fun. Fight along side Usagi, Tomoe, and Gennosuke as they thwart Lord Hikiji and his minions ... or create all new characters and stories from your own imagination! This game brings all the excitement of Stan Sakai's fantastic blend of Japanese history and legend to you.

To play this game, you will need pencil & paper, polyhedral dice (four-sided, six-sided, eight-sided, ten-sided, twelve-sided, and twenty-sided), and this book.

59526.name: Wizards & Gunslingers
59526.description:
From the back of the book:

The game is called Wizards and Gunslingers and this is the 200 page core rule-book which opens the door to your imagination.

Westrue is a land in which the laws are yet to be written. This is a place where might makes right and the quickest gun or the sharpest sword can make its wield-er a god. From the hot deserts of the east to the strange unexplored forests of the west, the continent of Westrue offers adventurers the opportunity to battle powerful creatures, discover awesome weapons and magic and make a name all at the same time in a world that smiles upon heroes and kicks dirt in the faces of those who fail.

Welcome to a world where gun toting lawmen battle side by side wizards and warriors in a desolate unexplored land newly discovered by humans. The place is called Westrue and it's your duty to carve your niche however you see fit. So you want to be a gunfighter, a wizard, a thief? Ya wanna be an evil villain or a hero who fights for right? Wanna gamble and cause a ruckus while you make your fortune or do you wanna be a business man that schemes and connives to become wealthy and powerful? Wanna rob a train, blast open a bank, bring criminals to justice or explore unmapped wilderness? Now you can. Do whatever you want in Wizards and Gunslingers.

This book contains all you need for beginning your campaign whether you are a player or a Game Master. Need weapons and magic, they live here. Need creatures and NPC's? They live here. Need realistic combat and an awesome skill system. They are here also. What if you get tired of the weapons, magic, NPC's or creatures contained in the book? No problem. You can create your own with our built in generators that enable you to let your imaginations soar. Whether you are looking for gaming scenarios, NPC's, creatures, magic, weapons, armor, or maps (plus much more) within this book you will find your prize. There exist no limits to what you can imagine.

Wizards and Gunslingers bids you enter.

59527.name: Honfoglaló: 1956
59527.description: Special edition of the game Honfoglaló, where players can conquer areas by answering trivia questions. (In some cases it is enough to guess better than your opponent.) In this edition the areas are districts of Budapest, and the questions are about the Hungarian revolution in 1956.

59528.name: In Grandpa's Woods: The Forest Trail of Discovery
59528.description:
In Grandpa's Woods is based on the children's book "In Grandpa's Woods" by Sharon Hart Addy. It is published by the Wisconsin Department of Natural Resources in celebration of 100 years of forestry in the state of Wisconsin. In Grandpa's Woods consists of two simple games, for two different age groups.

For younger children, suggested ages 4 to 8, the game is a basic roll and move. The first player to take 100 steps and reach Grandpa's cabin is the winner.

For suggested ages 9 and up, a trivia element is introduced. Players may not move forward until after they have correctly answered a trivia question about one of the following topics:
Forest Animals, Insects, and Plants
Forest Managemnent
Forest Facts
Forest History
Forest Benefits
People, Places, and Organizations

59529.name: Phoenix Command: Advanced Rules
59529.description:
From the back of the book:

The Advanced Phoenix Command Supplement expands on the rules provided in the Phoenix Command Combat System, allowing players to handle a wide variety of special situations. Each section is modular, making it easy for players to use the appropriate rules, and to select the exact level of game detail desired. More than 20 different sections are included, among them:

Blunt Trauma: When Body Armor stops a bullet, it only stops the penetration; it does not necessarily stop the severe bruising and possible broken bones which may result from the bullet's impact. The wounds caused by non-penetrating rounds, called Blunt Trauma, are fully discussed.

Smoke: A common factor on many battlefields, Smoke provides vital protection from the enemy during dashes across streets and open areas, towards hostile positions, and during retreats. The full effects of Smoke are explained including the duration of Smoke clouds generated by Smoke Grenades, the effects of wind on the cloud, and the partial visibility possible while the smoke clears.

Blind Fire: The standard response to enemy Smoke screens, Blind Fire (firing without being able to see the target) can also be vital in house-to-house fighting, when pinned by enemy fire, or providing harassing fire against unseen opponents.

Among the other sections included are: Ballistic Accuracy; Weapon Reliability and Weapon Damage; the Three Round Burst; Explosive Ammunition; Permanent Disabling Injuries; Effective Minimum Arc; Optical Scopes; Spotting; Cover Generation; Large Scale Battlefields; Leadership; Ground Burst Explosions; Mines and Traps; Time of Flight; Evasive Action; Recoil Recovery; Off Hand Fire; Free Actions; Skills; Training; and Experience.

59530.name: Tower of Babble
59530.description:
Tower of Babble is a party game in which players try to build 4 levels of a ziggurat. The game is played by drawing topic cards (such as "Russia", "DNA", "Shakespeare", or "Little Bighorn") and then talking about the subject for a specified amount of time. Players must speak in complete sentences, may not repeat themselves, and may not use words like "Um" or "Uh." The higher a players tower gets, the longer they must talk about the subject. If a player doesn't know anything about the subject they may make up their facts so long as they don't violate any of the other speaking rules.

The game includes a game board, tower pieces, and four sand timers in 30, 60, 90, and 120 increments. The first player to Babble through the 4th level is the winner.

59531.name: Zsoldosrege
59531.description: In this Hungarian ccg players choose leaders in the beginning of the game (basically they choose their strategy with it). There are four type of cards: mercenary, object, action and influence. Every turn there is a victory card with some victory points to win (typically by fighting of mercenaries), after the fifth one the game ends.

59532.name: Seikkailija (Issue 4 - 1989)
59532.description:
MERP Theme Issue.

Contents:

* Roolipelimaailman uutisia - News
* Erään velhon etsinnöt - A short story set in Middle-Earth
* Lyijymyrkytys - Miniatures column
* Keskimaan skenariot - A review of MERP modules
* Salaliitto - MERP Adventure
* Mitä druidit puhuvat - Using celtic languages in roleplaying
* Game reviews: Stormbringer, Hawkmoon
* Diplomatiapelit - Wargaming column
* Vartija - Comic

59533.name: Desolation
rpghonor: 2008 Indie RPG Awards - Best Production - Runner Up
2008 Indie RPG Awards - Best Support - Runner Up
2008 Indie RPG Awards - Game of the Year - Runner Up
rpgissuearticle: Fiction piece set in the post-apocalyptic world of Desolation.
59533.description:
From the back of the book:

High Fantasy Brought Low.

The sky turned red, the ground split, the oceans flooded, fire rained down, mythical beasts woke and magic lashed out.

You survived.

Will you seize power amidst the chaos, help rebuild civilization, remap the twisted remains of the world ... or will you even survive another day?

The story is yours to tell.

This book contains everything you need to play, including a complete setting, seven playable races, free-form magic rules and the Ubiquity Roleplaying System(tm), which emphasizes story and streamlined gaming.

59534.name: Desolation: Survivors
59534.description:
From the back of the book:

In Desolation, High Fantasy was Brought Low

Now, there is only survival.

The Night of Fire killed almost everyone, tearing apart the Ascondean Empire and surrounding nations. The Long Winter that followed tested those who remained to the breaking point.

You roleplay a survivor who has inherited the lands of Scondera -- or what remains of it.

Desolation: Survivors is a supplement to Desolation, the Post-Apocalyptic Fantasy Roleplaying Game. Survivors features new rules for creating orc, goblin, and kobold characters, dozens of new creatures, nearly 60 non-player characters and more than 20 new communities for your characters to discover.

The story is yours to tell.

59535.name: Tunnels & Trolls Characters
59535.description: 25 randomly pregenerated characters. Package of computer tractor paper printout, so each one is unique.

59536.name: Seikkailija (Issue 6 - 1990)
59536.description:
Contents:

* Kuopan pohjalta - Short reviews and news
* Humaktin testi - A short story set in Glorantha
* Aamuruskon kansa - Druids in RuneQuest
* Beth rydyn y derwyddon yn siarad? - Celtic names
* Innomine Padre et Filio et Spiritu Sancto... - Adventure for Basic D&D and RuneQuest
* Kuoppia ja kärmeksiä - D&D/AD&D House rules
* Game review: Space Master
* Strategiapelit - Wargaming column

59537.name: Baller-Ball
59537.description:
The board is a kind of hockey pitch, but four monkeys wield clubs to score goals with a ball. Behind each monkey there is a hole. When the ball falls into that hole, the respective monkey loses a banana point; when all points are lost, that monkey is out.
The monkeys can be turned and pushed back and forth with a knob; they move in a rail-like track.

59538.name: Basket Team
59538.description: The game is a basketball field with a basket on each end and 12 holes. In each hole there is an animal. When the ball rolls into a hole, the player who "owns" that hole can push a button on his/her side of the board, making the animal jump out of the hole and propelling the ball upwards. The score is counted electronically.

59539.name: Bravo
59539.description:
Each player places six "answer" cards face-down in front of him/her. A "question" card is flipped open, and the players now have to search for (or remember) where their corresponding answer card is. The first player to find it, hits a plastic hand in the center of the table. The hand flips down into the middle of the center piece. The player whose hand is at the bottom scores a point.
Question and answer cards are actually pictures. There are two sets: Animals and jobs.

59540.name: Chango
59540.description:
Each player has ten tiles with different patterns of holes. In each turn, they place a tile on the opponent's tile (stack), then turn the board so their opponent's tile is in front of them again. The object is to cover as many holes of the opponent's last tile as possible. The player who manages that better gets the difference between the holes covered by both players in points for that round. Whoever has most points after ten tiles is the winner.
This game is the base of New York.

59541.description: Each kid has a large caterpillar which is trying to reach an apple. The caterpillars are lying next to each other (facing opposite directions) and consist of seven different color segments. The active player spins an arrow which determines a color. The player then moves his/her caterpillar so the determined color is next to the same color segment of the opponent. The first player to reach his/her apple in this totally random game is the winner.
59541.name: Colorpillar

59542.name: The Magnificent Flying Machine Rally
59542.description:
From the cover " Join the pioneers of early flight with this engrossing board game and relive their dangerous and exciting adventures. An exciting flying game for 2-6 players. Race from London to Paris outwitting your opponents on the way and avoid the perils of flight, remembering to collect your landing card on the way."

A fairly simple racing game in which movement is determined by the throw of dice.

59543.name: Den Letzten beißen die Hunde
59543.description: Each player has a number of cat pieces; there is also a "neutral" dog. The players roll a die, moving there cats toward the target area. When a player rolls a dog symbol, though, the dog moves forward one square. If the dog reaches a cat, that cat is removed from the game. The cats can try to reach trees as well, which are safe from the dog. At the end of the game, each cat that got away gets ten points, each cat in a tree gets 1-8 points (depending on the position of the tree).

59545.name: Slaves of Fate
59545.description:
From the back of the book:

Following the decline of the bright empire of Melniboné, nations of the newly named Young Kingdoms struggle to assert themselves and thus ensure their place in the new world order.

The island-nation of Pan Tang seeks most to emulate feared Melniboné, sending her marauders across the oceans to secure slaves, both as labor for her growing industry and as sacrifices in dark magical rituals.

You have fallen prey to these depraved slavers. Are your cunning and skill enough to escape a gruesome fate?


A D20 System Adventure for 1st to 3rd level adventurers
Set in the world of Elric, as created by Michael Moorcork

59546.name: Dragon (Issue 289 - Nov 2001)
rpgissuearticle: Bazaar of the Bizarre - Cup & Chalice
Dungeoncraft: Raiders of the Lost world
Elminster's Guide to the Realms - The Shunned Street
Playful Phoenix Fist vs Four Scholars Boxing
Rogues Gallery: the Foes of Stormweather II
Silent Warriors: Three New Ninja Classes
The History of the Ninja: Black-Clad Assassins
The Play's the Thing: Ability Combos II
Thunder and Fire - The World of the Kaiju
59546.description:
Dragon Magazine
Volume XXVII, No. 6
Issue 289
November 2001

Oriental Adventures

Cover Art by Jon Foster

59547.description:
Truffle Scuffle is a quick strategy game in which two players race to collect the most of each type of truffle.

Players take turns moving their truffle hogs (whose keen noses can sniff out a truffle miles away) through the forest, collecting any of the five different types of truffles they find. By sacrificing sets of truffles, players can enlist the aid of more truffle hogs to speed up the search. However, sacrifice too many truffles and your opponent will easily win; once all the truffles have been collected, whoever has collected the most truffles in at least 3 types, wins. Your reputation as the best hunter of truffles is at stake!
59547.name: Truffle Scuffle
boardgamefamily: Games by the Game Artisans of Canada

59549.name: Die Meisterschaft
59549.description:
German football game. The game consists of 60 cards with photos of Bundesliga players (season 1978/79). Each player places 13 player cards on the board (2 replacements). Then a scoring sheet is consulted which gives the gradings that the players received after each match day in the season of 78/79. Card by card the players compare the gradings; the better one scores a goal. Whoever scores most goals is the winner of the match; repeat for further matches or even a season.

The game is extremely random; other than choosing the team it is mostly bookkeeping.

59550.name: Die Zehn
59550.description: Players take turns placing a number tile on a grid (11 x 11). When a row or column is formed which sums up to ten, the player who placed the last tile gets as many points as the number of tiles involved. Some "double" or "triple" squares exist which increase the players' points. The player with most points after 100 tiles is the winner.

59552.name: Der Traum des Roten Gottes
59552.description:
User summary

Der Traum des Roten Gottes (The Red God's Dream) is a Stormbringer adventure that was published only in German.

In this adventure, the characters have to prevent the Red God from returning to the Young Kingdoms.


From the back of the book

Der Traum des Roten Gottes und böse Vorahnungen verstricken die Gefährten in ein atemberaubendes Abenteuer für das Fantasy-Rollenspiel Michael Moorcocks STURMBRINGER, bei dem die Abenteurer keinen geringeren als einen rachedurstigen Gott zum Gegner haben.

Es ist der Rote Gott, der auf Rache sinnt, denn vor vielen Jahrtausenden wurde sein Volk aus Eshmir vertrieben, und er selbst ließ sich durch die Versprechungen Balos, des Spaßmachers des Chaos, blenden und auf eine unwirtliche Ebene des Multiversums locken.

Doch nun ist die Zeit der Rückkehr und Vergeltung gekommen. Als Vorboten seiner grausamen Macht überzieht er die nördlichen Regionen Eshmirs mit dem Roten Tod -einer Seuche, vor der sich nicht nur die Abenteurer selbst schützen müssen.

Das Weinende Schiff
An Bord eines fremdartigen Flußschiffes finden sich die Abenteurer in alptraumhafte Geschehnisse verstrickt, in deren Mittelpunkt ein schreiender Säugling steht.

Durch die Wüste
Der Weg durch die Tränenwüste ist ebenso beschwerlich wie gefährlich. Hungrige Feuerwesen, blinde Greifvögel und Nomaden bringen die Abenteurer in Bedrängnis.

Am Rande eines lieblichen Landes
Im Lande Eshmir angekommen, treffen die Abenteurer in Mirszjin auf das Rote Gespenst, und ihre Vorahnungen um die Rückkehr des Roten Gottes verdichten sich.

Das Strahlende Elwher
In der Hauptstadt Eshmirs müssen sich die Abenteurer Zugang zu den Beratungen des Königs verschaffen, um ihn vor dem Untergang seines Reiches zu warnen.

Verhängnis über Bandshuun
In der Provinzstadt Bandshuun am Mondsee stehen die Abenteurer dem Roten Gott gegenüber, der im Begriff ist, in die Jungen Königreiche zurückzukehren.

59554.name: Epic of Ærth
59554.description:
Book 3 of Dangerous Journeys

From the back cover:

"Six Worlds in One!

"This is the sourcebook for the fantasy milieu you've always dreamed of!

"The world of Ærth is hauntingly familiar, yet strangely mysterious.

"Visit Æropa's Avillonian Isles, which include mighty Lyonesse. See the "Dark Continent" of Afrik, travelling up the Nylle River, past Ægypt's four great pyramids, to the unexplored lands of the interior. Or cruise the long reaches of the Mare Ostrum which reaches from eastern Æropa to the steppes of Central Azir. And then there are the seven lakes of distant Vargaard...."

User summary

The Epic of Ærth also covers the mazes carved into the world's crust and the hollow interior where ancient life forms still dwell.

59555.name: Memoir '44: Das deutsche Umrüstungs-Set
59555.description:
A fan initiated german upgrade kit for Memoir '44.

It consists of the following parts:
1) a fully translated card deck, consisting of 220 command and summary cards, to be ordered from the DoW-Webshop
2) translations of all rules in original layout for free download in the rules section or here
3) translated scenarios in the Military Archives (click the german flag in the scenario info column to access)

So you only have to buy the card deck, the rest is free!

Part of Memoir '44 series.

59556.description:
New Squadron pack for the Wings of War series set in WWII. The Polikarpov I-16 is featured: a fighter that fought in the Spanish Civil War, in the second Sino-Japanese war and then in the Second World War. Schemes for all these conflicts are provided, including captured Spanish nationalist, Romanian and Finnish planes.

Part of the Wings of War series.
59556.name: Wings of War: Revolution in the Sky Squadron Pack
boardgameexpansion: Wings of War: Fire from the Sky
Wings of War: The Dawn of World War II
boardgamefamily: Wings of Glory / Wings of War

59557.name: Shatterzone
rpgissuearticle: Alien Technology: The Gencenter for the Shatterzone Game
Index to the Shatterzone Box Set
59557.description:
From the back of the box

Space is Big ... Life is Hard ...

You just melted the barrel of your Gurtmann HMG. Your armor's shot full of holes, and you know there are at least five more guns on your tail. The last time you checked, no cavalry was comin' over the hill. And you've still got to fly the shatterzone.

You though you were going to get rich. You thought you were going to get home. Now it looks all you may get is dead.

All in all, a helluva bad day.

The Rule Book. The Universe Guide. The Player's Guide to Shatterzone. The Action Card Deck. Two ten-sided custom dice. The first issue of the Shatterzone newsletter. It's all in this box. It's all you need to play.

And the universe isn't just a game anymore.

59558.name: Shatterzone: The Rule Book
59558.description:
From the back of the book

The Universe isn't a Game anymore.

The only hope for a better tomorrow lies in surviving today, and to do that, you have to know the rules. This book gives gamemasters what they need to know to run adventures in the Shatterzone universe: details on combat and interaction, The Action Card Deck, space travel, ships, tips on how to design adventures and campaigns, and much more.

59560.name: Shatterzone: The Players' Guide
59560.description:
From the back of the book

Life is Hard...

Surviving the Shatterzone universe isn't easy, but this book gives players everything they need to know to lead their characters to success in space or on any of countless worlds. Included here are details on character generation, attributes and skills, basic rules players should know, psionics, and character profiles to get you started. This book is designed for use by both players and gamemasters.

59561.name: Shatterzone:  The Universe Guide
59561.description:
From the back of the book

Space is Big...

Explore the exciting universe of Shatterzone, from the heart of the Core Worlds to the mysterious and deadly shatterzone itself. Encounter the power of Fleet, Armagons, fringers and shatrats as you travel to worlds whose secrets await discovery. Also included in this book are details on equipment, alien species, megacorporations and Xenos Sector, a campaign setting for Shatterzone.

59562.name: Tech Book: Ships
rpgitemversion: ShipTech (Classic Reprint of Tech Book: Ships) PDF
59562.description:
From the back of the book

"Four ... no, five bogeys coming in at three-five. I've got radar locks - rake an' bake 'em!"

"Negative, negative; we still have to online the 'racks! Get us some breathing room!"

"There ain't no breathing room in a vacuum! We've got to -"

Tech Book: Ships contains an expanded combat system for use with the basic Shatterzone rules. It also provides a complete section on spaceship and starship construction.

Take a trip to the 'zone under your own power ... or float home frozen.

59563.name: Through the Cracks
59563.description:
From the back of the book

It's a tense moment: Five people you thought were your friends are staring across a table at you. No one speaks while they wait for you to come up with something. If you freeze up now, you'll be at their mercy.

No prisoners.
No second chances.
You've got the hardest job in the universe ... you're the gamemaster

Suddenly, you reach for the Shatterzone supplement Through the Cracks. Before anyone can speak, you say confidently, "Okay, everyone, here's what we're gonna do ..."

It's good to be back in control.

59564.name: Crosshairs
59564.description:
From the back of the book

The Return to Teraxiter

A campaign supplement for Shatterzone

"What you bring to Teraxiter is not as important as what you leave here. The denizens of the city will take everything you have - and more, if they can get it.

Breaking even is losing on this planet where megacorps vie with gang-bangers for dominance. Coming out ahead means coming out alive."

59565.name: Brain Burn
59565.description:
User summary

Brain Burn is an adventure module for Shatterzone.


From the back of the book

Brain Burn: (v.) A genegeneering process through which the patient receives a concentrated fragment of knowledge in an abbreviated amount of time, often with harmful side effects.

59567.name: Hardware
59567.description:
User summary:

"Hardware" is the companion book to the Italian version of "Cyberpunk 2020". It contains the final chapters (11 to 15) of the original English language Cyberpunk 2020 rulebook, translated in Italian and with some new artwork.

59568.name: War's End
59568.description:
From the Back of the Book:

For five years, the Possibility Wars have raged across the globe. Now, at last, the Storm Knights face their greatest challenge, the battle that will save the world... or destroy it.

From the palace of Dr. Mobius to a mid-air battle with Tharkoldu; from a witch-burning in Boston to a struggle of Nightmares in New Orleans; and finally, the ultimate clash of good and evil beneath the desert sun. The Knights will need every bit of skill, luck and possibility energy they possess to survive.

Also included in this super-adventure are post-Possiblity War scenarios, a Torg-MasterBook conversion, and details on the pocket dimension of Arachnidia.

Get ready... this one ends it all.

59569.name: Operation: Hard Sell
59569.description:
From the back of the book

The Near Now. The Possibility Wars rage on, but this time the battle is on the West Coast. The participants are Nippon Tech™ and the Living Land.™ Caught in the middle are the residents of Oregon, and their lives are the prize.

The United States has won an important battle for the West Coast. Sacramento and the rest of northern California have been reclaimed from Baruk Kaah's primitive Living Land realm.

Or so everyone thought. Northern California has not been reclaimed, but taken over by the rival Nippon Tech realm. Profit and greed are motivating the Kanawa Corporation, and it is not satisified. Oregon is next on Kanawa's list. As for the people who still live in Oregon ... there won't be any if the Storm Knights™ don't stop Operation: Hard Sell.

"Thank you for your cooperation. Do not worry about how we will do it, just be assured that we will reclaim Oregon."

—Hiro Semetako to the Delphi Council

59570.name: The Temple of Rec Stalek
59570.description:
From the back of the book

The Near Now. While the Possibility Wars continue to spread, a twisted edeinos bent on revenge hatches a plot that could change the face of the Living Land forever. Calling upon the power of a dark god, he threatens the life of Baruk Kaah and the very future of the realm.

Bizarre edeinos clad in bone armor and wielding swords have been raiding resistance communities throughout Illinois. Backed by undead Living Land creatures, these war parties have kidnapped a small group of humans and carried them to Takta Ker.

Their goal is a dark and bloody one: having resurrected the edeinos god of Death, they plan to use its power to slay Baruk Kaah and make their leader the new High Lord. The Storm Knights must survive a nightmarish trek through Death's gauntlet and an explosive battle in a Takta Ker temple if they wish to save the humans and stop the creation of a far more deadly Living Land.

59571.name: Queenswrath
59571.description:
From the back of the book

"By Order of Pella Ardinay, Lady of the Light..."

So begins each of the documents called Queenswraths, proclamations calling all knights of honor to do battle with the forces of corruption and darkness on behalf of the Speaker of the People of Aysle. Only the most evil and powerful enemies of the magical realm find their names on these decrees. Do you have what it takes to undergo a quest for the Lady of the Light?

Throughout the realm of Aysle, from the shores of England to the fjords of Scandinavia, the servants of darkness continue their war of conquest and corruption. Lady Pella Ardinay stands as a bright light within the gathering darkness, calling the servants of good and honor to battle for the defense of the realm.

From agents of the Cyberpapacy operating in Oslo to monsters under Lord Uthorion's command rampaging in Ireland, from deadly skeleton cultists to warring faerie nations, Aysle has more than its share of the Possibility War's evil. And now Lady Ardinay is calling for help.

Queenswrath is full of adventure hooks set in the fantasy realm of Aysle. It comes complete with villains and their statistics, dreadful plans and plots against honor, and maps of important new locations. Pella Ardinay provides the quests — you provide the Storm Knights and the courage to see them through!

59572.name: When Axioms Collide
59572.description:
From the back of the book

The Near Now . As the Possibility Wars™ turn realms against each other, an Orrorshan Nightmare seizes control of a portion of the GodNet with a diabolical plan to use the Cyberpapacy's greatest weapon against it.

The people of New Culmont have more to fear than the Inquisition and gospog attacks. Their young women are being murdered, their bodies stripped of cyberware. And the killer leaves a taint of horror behind him unlike anything they've ever known ...

The bloody trail leads into the GodNet, where spectral figures have been seen and a strange, ebon-hued creature has torn apart innocent deckers. From a trial by fire to battles with horrors both in and out of the Net, the Knights must plunge into a whirlpool of fear if they wish to save the lives of thousands.

59573.name: Celtic Legends
59573.description:
From the back of the book:

Role-Playing Games have evolved! Celtic Legends bring new life to Heroic Fantasy, since the action takes place in the legendary past of Ireland, Great Britain and Gaul, rather than in a totally artificial world. The players set off on adventures in a world where the marvelous is a part of daily life: magicians accomplish prodigious feats and the bravest of men show themselves to be the equals of the gods.

Players freely choose the character they wish to embody, whether knights, warrior-magicians, druids, bards or spies... There are numerous possibilities, and each character is unique.
Though warriors' exploits are important to this game, combat is hardly the only way of proving oneself. The rules allow the players to compete in skill and cunning, participate in poetic jousts, or subjugate an audience through their prestige and eloquence... in short, to act in every way like the heroes of legends.

"Now Nuada knew his past, his present, and his future. He raised his large shield slowly toward the sun and brandished his sword. The morning light danced along the magic blade. The second battle of Mag Tured was about to begin..."

rpg: SOF - Die Welt der Söldner und Spezialeinheiten
59575.name: SOF - Die Welt der Söldner und Spezialeinheiten
59575.description:
User summary

This is the rulebook for SOF. It was printed on a laser printer and came in a folder with punch holes.

The rulebook contains:


Character creation rules
Background information on military and intelligence organisations and special forces units
Skill and combat rules
Rules for vehicle combat
Extensive weapons and equipment descriptions

59576.description:
Description from the publisher:

Weiß Schwarz is a CCG produced in collaboration with some of the most popular animation/ video game works in Japan. Players separate the "Weiß" side which features mainly pretty characters from the "Schwarz" side featuring cool characters.

Though the title consists of various kinds of card sets, a carefully planned system and rules make it possible for players to mix any of them on each side and enjoy the game.
59576.name: Weiß Schwarz

59577.name: Ruf des Warlock
59577.description:
User summary

This is the Ruf des Warlock (The Warlock's Cry) rules box. It contains:


176-page Regelwerk (Rule Book)
148-page Zauberbuch (Magic Book)
a full-color poster map of Tanaris in A2 format
32 loose sheets for various purposes (character sheets, combat sheets, etc.)
2d30

59578.name: Das Corangear-Fragment
59578.description:
User summary

Das Corangear-Fragment (The Corangear Fragment) is an adventure for Ruf des Warlock characters of levels 10-15.

On their stay on the island of Yaisk, the characters' souls are accidentally exchanged into the bodies of prisoners that have been given the chance to be free by braving a deadly dungeon. Now the characters are in their place and have to escape.


From the back of the book

Yaisk, das magische Eiland, der Hort der Zauberer. Gefürchtet von den Barbarenvölkern des Nordens und verhaßt bei den Druiden. Warum es die Helden auf die Insel im fahlen Meer verschlug? Eine gute Frage, doch im Moment zweitrangig. Läuft der Aufenthalt in der berühmten Hauptstadt des Magier-Reiches doch völlig anders als geplant. Dinge geschehen, die so unerklärlich sind, daß man nicht einmal im Ansatz ahnt, was dahinterstecken könnte. Unglücklicherweise bleibt jedoch nicht die geringste Zeit, erhellende Nachforschungen anzustellen. Die Gruppe der Abenteurer steckt so tief im Desaster, daß es erst einmal nur ein Ziel gibt: Überleben!

Hat man die ersten Hürden hinter sich gelassen, stößt man endlich auf Menschen, die mehr wissen als unsere ahnungslosen Freunde. Doch jetzt fangen die Probleme erst richtig an...

Das „Corangear - Fragment" ist ein Kampf auf Leben und Tod; ein Wettstreit, in dem alle Mittel erlaubt sind und es nur einen Sieger geben kann. Die unsichtbaren Kräfte im Hintergrund ziehen die Fäden: die Helden sind Gefangene und Opfer ihrer brutalen Spiele. Keine Zeit zum Ausruhen, kein Ort des Friedens, keine Antworten auf drängende Fragen. Als dann auch noch ein Cherubim eingreift, scheint die Lage aussichtslos...

Das „Corangear - Fragment" ist ein RdW-Abenteuer für eine Heldengruppe mit drei bis fünf Charakteren im Stufenbereich 10-15. Das Buch enthält nicht nur eine ausführliche Szenario-Beschreibung, sondern auch zwei neue Charakterklassen. Monsterbeschreibungen, Werte, detaillierte Pläne und Grundrisse sowie ein integriertes Brettspiel runden dieses Werk ab und machen es zu einem echten Lesevergnügen für den zynischen RdW-Master und zu einer wahren Herausforderung für alle Helden und solche, die sich dafür halten!

Das „Corangear - Fragment" ist ein Kampf auf Leben und Tod!

59579.name: Schlummernde Mächte
59579.description:
User summary

Schlummernde Mächte (Slumbering Powers) is a Ruf des Warlock adventure for characters of levels 1-4.

The mayor of Harandon hires the characters to investigate some mysterious events. It all starts when the cellarer of the city's opera vanishes and leaves a writing that predicts the city's destruction. Several factions will make life hard for the characters while they try to uncover the secrets behind this.


From the back of the book

Was geht vor in der berühmten Oper von Harandon? Welche „schlummernden Mächte" sind am Werk? Der Stadtherr Tudor Longa ist beunruhigt: sein Kellermeister ist verschwunden und hinterließ ein geheimnisvolles Schriftstück, in dem der Untergang der Stadt prophezeit wird. Da kommen die fremden Helden gerade recht denn wem sollte Tudor sonst trauen können?

Mit der Annahme dieses Auftrages verstricken sich die Helden in ein Stadtabenteuer allererster Güte. Skurrile Gestalten, Bandenbosse, verbotene Sekten und ein uraltes Geheimnis warten auf die mutigen Abenteurer!

Gruppenabenteuer für Ruf des Warlock

Schlummernde Mächte ist ein tolles Fantasy-Abenteuer mit vielen Nichtspielercharakteren, Beschreibungen, einem Stadtplan und einem „kriminalistischen1' Puzzle, das es zu lösen gilt. Und erst wenn alle Teile zusammengefugt sind, kann die Heldengruppe verstehen, was in der Stadt Harandon tatsächlich gespielt wird. Der Einsatz ist jedoch höher, als sie glaubt! Gelingt es ihr trotzdem, das Verderben aufzuhalten?

Spannende, vetrackte Fantasy - mit einem gehörigen Schuß Humor und vielen ironischen Seitenhieben - ein echtes RDW-Abenteuer eben!

Für 3 - 6 Helden der KEP- und WEP-Stufen 1 - 4

59580.name: Die Träne der Verzweiflung
59580.description:
User summary

Die Träne der Verzweiflung (The Tear of Desperation) is a Ruf des Warlock adventure for characters of levels 1-3.

The characters are kidnapped by a vampire and are used as living supplies of blood. When the vampire is away for a while, they get the chance to escape. But getting rid of the chains is easier than actually fleeing from the mansion.


From the back of the book

'" ... Da ihr Geschöpfe meiner Tränen seid, sollt ihr auch die Namen tragen, die der Grund für diese Tränen waren: Wut, Haß, Niedertracht, Enttäuschung und Verzweiflung. Die Menschen sollen Euch 'Vampyre' nennen; ein Schrecken in der Nacht, und als solcher werdet ihr mein Wort verbreiten und Unheil über alle Kreaturen bringen ... "'

Eher unfreiwillig machen die Helden Bekanntschaft mit der "Träne der Verzweiflung":. Wird es noch gelingen, aus der Gefangenschaft zu entkommen?

Dieses Luxus-Abenteuer für Ruf des Warlock ist für 3-6 Spieler der KEP- und WEP-Stufen 1-3 und einen Master. Spannendes, durchdachtes Rollenspiel auf über 70 Seiten! Viele Spielhilfen enthalten: Hauspläne, NSC-Beschreibungen, Charakterbögen, Master-Kampf liste und mehr.

59581.name: Die Faust des Titanen
59581.description:
User summary

Die Faust des Titanen (The Fist of the Titan) is a Ruf des Warlock adventure for characters of levels 1-5.

A storm and an enemy fleet drives the characters and their ship into the harbor of Unval, a besieged city. The dwarves and humans inside the city mistrust each other and the atmosphere is on the brink of civil war. Dwarves and humans are murdered, one of them the characters' ship's captain. They become suspects in those cases and are surrounded by enemies. On top of that, an otherworldly mystery awaits to be solved.


From the back of the book

"Es geht die Sage, daß die Titanen von den fünf Herren der Dunkelheit gerufen wurden, um auf der flachen Erde Schrecken und Verzweiflung unter jenen zu säen, die den Engeln höhnten und spotteten und sich nicht ihrem Willen unterwerfen wollten. Doch der Titan, das grausamste Geschöpf, das jemals seinen Schritt über Tanaris lenkte, hatte seinen eigenen Willen und ließ sich nicht von jenen beherrschen, die ihm zu befehlen dachten. Keinem gelang es, die entsetzlichen Zerstörungen aufzuhalten, die das Land aufwühlten wie der eiserne Pflug den spröden Acker. Die Titanen waren unbarmherzig, ohne Furcht und schier unbesiegbar. Kein Bericht drang an die Ohren der Chronisten, der von dem Tod eines wandelnden Giganten Kunde brachte. Die Cherubime der Finsternis nutzen die Kräfte der Titanen, doch gar lästerliche Zungen behaupten, daß selbst die Herren dieser Welt Angst vor den Geschöpfen aus einer fernen Dimension hatten..."

Die Heldengruppe dieses Abenteuers wird durch zufällige Ereignisse in einen Krieg verwickelt, der ebenso mysteriös wie aussichtslos erscheint. Für die Charaktere scheint es kein Entkommen zu geben, sie sind schuldlos eingewoben in ein Netz aus Mißtrauen, Verzweiflung und Haß. Die Feinde scheinen überall zu sein, und die wenigen Freunde sind hilflos. Was soll da ein kleiner, belangloser Auftrag bewirken, der die Stunden vor dem Tod nur verkürzen kann?

„Die Faust des Titanen" ist kein Abenteuer für zwischendurch! Weitgehend in einer Stadt angesiedelt, verbreitet das Abenteuer dennoch ein etwas anderes Flair, als man es von einem Stadt-Szenario erwarten würde; es bietet ein Höchstmaß an Spannung und Unterhaltung für all jene Spieler, die gewillt sind, sich von der düsteren Atmosphäre einfangen zu lassen und ihren Charakteren durch alle Höhen und Tiefen des Lebens zu folgen - vor allem durch die Tiefen ...

Ein RdW-Abenteuer für eine Heldengruppe mit drei bis fünf Charakteren im Stufenbereich 1-5. Das Abenteuer enthält komplette Spielwerte, detaillierte Pläne, Grundrisse sowie einen Stadtplan.

Wie alle RdW-Bände verlangt auch die „Faust des Titanen" Höchstleistungen von den Spielern, denn das Überleben auf der flachen Erde will täglich neu gelernt sein!

59582.name: A Companion to Superworld
59582.description:
This Superworld Companion expands the world of super-powered roleplaying. It includes: changes for and variants of Superworld powers: new ways to use powers such as Absorption, Defense, Dimension Shift, Emotion Control, Fortune, Gimmick, Illusion Projection, Invisibility, Martial Arts, Mimic, MicroSIZ, Reduction, Resistance, Snare, and Teleport.

New Powers: Aura Enhancement, Aura Defense, Cancellation, Clairvoyance, Cosmic Consciousness, Hex, Immunity, Infection, Lightfoot, Mental Image, Microscopic Vision, Paralysis, Possession, Power Sense, Quake, Resurection, Shield, Siphon, Special Sense, Tongues, Transform, Ultraviolet Vision, Verification, Wall, and Weather Control.

Also included in the Superworld Companion are conversion systems to Champions and to Villians and Vigilantes, an indepth treatment of weather and weather-related powers in Superworld, and a fully described base with working danger rooms for heroes or villains (usable with Superworld and Champions).

59583.name: Trouble For HAVOC
59583.description:
From the back of the book:

Three Superpowered Battles!

"We HAVOC supervillains are professionals who only want to do our job creating as much havoc as possible. Why do these superheroes insist on getting in the way? A small reactor! Is that too much to ask?

If the superheroes don’t want us to borrow federal property, we’d be glad to grab the power source of a race which never pays taxes the Elokians have an underground city and an alien technology. King Snake merely desires their ridiculous little sun to energize his earthquake-maker. Hah, hah, hah, hah!

If we want, we may help ourselves to that spaceship downed in the Antarctic. LUMIERE won’t mind the cold, or the aliens neither would I, AIRHAMMER, with my superior speed and lethal airblast.

All who have opposed us have failed! What puny superheroes dare try again?"

Trouble for HAVOC contains three complete adventures intended for SUPERWORLD and CHAMPIONS players.

59585.name: Val-du-Loup
59585.description:
From the Publisher:

Adventures in the Heart of the Ardennes Forests

A small, backward region of the dense, primal Ardennes forests. The Church wields little influence among the counties and baronies along the river Loup. Christian fervor clashes with Frankish and Celtic traditions. Barons feud for land, while greedy princes, the Prince-Bishop of Liège and the Count of Luxembourg, grab the last tidbits left of the Empire. Here it takes heroes to confront the challenges of a world in conflict.

BASIC ROLEPLAYING MONOGRAPHS are longer works by one or more authors on a subject of import to Basic Roleplaying players. On these products the author has also fulfilled the functions of editor and layout artist; we at Chaosium have done little in the way of editorial. We found these works compelling and thought that you would enjoy them. Through the publication of monographs we can offer our most loyal fans more information more easily, and evaluate the potential of these works for eventual release to the wholesale market.

59586.name: Der Kasten des Lebens
59586.description:
From the Adventure:

In this adventure a old and honored labrat asks for a favor. Scarear Farsight Fountreader Whitefur is missing his only living daughter and the characters are asked to find her...

The module can be downloaded for free on http://www.projekt-kopfkino.de/

59587.name: Rottenzeit
59587.description:
Example ratpack templates from the ratpack contest.


Die Flüchtlinge (The Refugees) by Markus Lawo
Die Gitterläufer (The Gridrunners) by Anna Sophie Rebmann
Die Träger (The Carriers) by Corbinian Seref
Die Tempelratten (The Templerats) by Katharina Prost


Free download on http://www.projekt-kopfkino.de/

59589.name: Oink Oink
59589.description:
From the publisher website:
An amusing dice game for 2-6 players aged 4 years and up.
You will need concentration, good reflexes and quickness if you want to imitate the animals' language

Rule summary:
One player role the dice with animals on them. When the dice stop rolling players must find missing animals and imitate their language.

59590.name: The Elfquest Companion
59590.description:
From the back of the book

More Roleplaying in The World of Two Moons

The Elfquest Campaign expands the scope of the Elfquest game, and provides long hours of game enjoyment.


Errata for Elfquest smooths the flow of the game and adds material from issues 19 and 20 to the game-rules.
Finding an Elf Name explores the origins of elf names and the reasons for which particular names are bestowed upon individual elves.
Help with Elf Design aids players and game-masters to determine appearance and personality for elf characters.
Wolf Ecology on Two Worlds explores the similarities and differences between Earthly wolves and their counterparts from the World of the Two Moons.
The Wolfhaven Holt provides a home for player-character Wolfriders who are not from the stories.
The Dying River is a scenario for Wolfrider characters in which the elves must stop a tribe of trolls from polluting a river and killing the elves' forest.
Fire Flight is a scenario which pits a band of Plainsrunner player-elves against their worst enemy — a prairie fire.
Characters: game statistics for 17 characters from the stories are included.

59592.name: The Lawnmower Man
59592.description:
From the back of the book

Virtual Reality Role Playing Game

THE WAR FOR VIRTUAL REALITY HAS BEGUN

In the near future, the computer-generated environments called Virtual Reality are revolutionizing education, research, and cybernetics. When scientists applied this new technology to Jobe Smith, a simple-minded gardener that everyone called The Lawnmower Man, they gave him everything he had lacked; intelligence, knowledge, physical strength, and even psychic powers. In the process of giving Jobe an array of superhuman abilities, they destroyed his sanity. Deranged and dangerous, he transformed himself into CyberJobe™, an immensely powerful cybernetic creature living inside the DataNet, the world's computer network. His transformation started the War for Virtual Reality.

The Virtual Reality War is spreading through the DataNet and around the globe. Governments, corporations and individuals are waging secret battles against each other and against CyberJobe for control of the latest Virtual Reality technologies. It is the dawn of the Cybernetic Age, and espionage, conventional weapons, and the full range of Virtual Reality abilities are the tools that will determine the outcome of the War.

Now you can join in the fight for the control of the future. You will use Virtual Reality to learn and to acquire new abilities, to travel the DataNet, to wield psychic forces, and more. But you will find opponents with powers just as remarkable as your own, and will face the special dangers of Virtual Reality; living opponents and intelligent computers, the constant strains on your sanity, and CyberJobe himself. The risks are immense; so are the rewards.

Based on the hit film from New Line Cinema, The Lawnmower Man Virtual Reality Role-Playing Game is fully compatible with the other film-based games from.Leading Edge and includes complete rules for Virtual Reality, Psychic Powers, modern Combat, and everything else you need for the most compelling Virtual Reality game there is.

Included are rules for:

Character Generation and Background
Combat, Survival, Espionage, and Science Skills
Settings and Campaigns
Investigations
Personal Equipment
Computers and Technology
Individual Combat
Ground and Air Vehicles
Virtual Reality - Skills, Training, Combat and more
Project 5
CyberJobe and his Servants

59596.name: The Kingdoms of Kalamar
59596.description:
User summary

The Kingdoms of Kalamar is the original Kalamar campaign setting box. At this time it is still a generic setting not designed for any special RPG system (but with Dungeons & Dragons in mind).


From the back of the box

WHEREIN you will explore the lands of Tellene, a world filled with powerful sorceries, strange races, clashing armies, deadly political maneuvering, chivalrous heroes, scheming villains, fantastic gods and their zealous priesthoods, ancient tongues, clandestine power groups and much, much more.

INTRICATELY designed with the proper blend of magic and realism, the Kingdoms of Kalamar™ fantasy campaign setting will satisfy the needs of even the most demanding gamers. Geographic and historical research were used to create Tellene's topography, populations, armies, cities and laws. Yet, the numerous schools of magic, priesthoods and supernatural marvels of Tellene exemplify the aura of high fantasy that pervades the realms.

The KINGDOMS OF KALAMAR™ boxed set comes fully loaded with:


Volume I: Sourcebook of the Sovereign Lands. This 100 page tome details the history of the peoples and nations of Tellene. From the depths of the mysterious Vohven Jungle to the vast savanna of the Drhokker horse-lords, the Sourcebook of the Sovereign Lands describes every kingdom, race and topographical feature.
Volume II: Mythos of the Divine and Worldly. Over 40 new deities and religions are painstakingly described within this 88 page guidebook. Secret organizations, languages, runes, constellations, astronomical marvels and an eight page index are also included in Volume II.
A magnificently detailed, 3' by 4' full-color map that comes in two sections depicting the eastern and western halves of the continent. Brilliantly created, this painting has been called the finest fantasy map on the market. As an added bonus, a calibrated hex-map overlay for accurate distance determination is included.


The KINGDOMS OF KALAMAR™ is ready for adventure with any fantasy roleplaying system.

59597.name: Agents of the Crown
59597.description:
From the book:

AGENTS OF THE CROWN combines Victorian heroic action in the tradition of pulp stories, comic books, and the Penny Dreadfuls of the 19th century with the solid play and tremendous versatility of the Basic Roleplaying system.

Agents of the Crown allows players to take the roles of super-agents in Victorian England serving Queen and Country combating evil in a myriad of forms. Whether foiling assassination attempts against the country’s Royals or members of Parliament, or rooting out vile cult activity amidst the sweat and squalor of London’s Bainbridge Rookery, the operatives of her Royal Majesty Queen Victoria know the truth. Evil is out there.

Its minions are legion. They inhabit the edges of England’s vast, world-spanning empire, corrupting, waiting for their chance to sew chaos and disorder. And so the Agents of the Crown must face these threats as they come. Their lives are sometimes lost in the cause, but never given cheaply. Indeed, the Agents possess powers and skills beyond the average man or woman’s. Whether by accident of birth, or from the borne of the world’s brave new sciences, they are often more than human. Yet still it is their courage that most sets them apart from ordinary citizens, for they must endure hardships that run the gamut of human experience and beyond. One day it might be a terrible threat from beyond space and time, while the next it might be an all too human killer who stalks the innocent along rain-slicked cobblestone streets.

59598.name: Light Without Shadow, Blade Without Edge
59598.description:
From the book:

A Fantasy Adventure For BRP Heroes

An ancient curse kills an obscure order of monks. Aeons later, the last island of human existence struggles against new masters of the world. Blood from those long-dead monks is the key to human salvation and the last vial belongs to a vampire. You must steal it.

59599.name: Die Zeit flieht!
59599.description:
A Ratten! Adventure.

From the adventure intro:

„Secrets are like greens - their roots lie in the depth and dark. Even the ratlair was build on long forgotten secrets, which lurk in the shadows. And he who digs those roots risks to collapse what did grow out of them.“
(Warning from Jackanapes Timeknower of the Labrats to the Heropack)

Upwords Deluxe features two great games - the main game plus an additional Challenge game, for two players or team.

The 3D word building game.
Make words by linking letters to existing ones or by stacking letters up. Just one letter can make a difference - fan can be fin or fun... which is exactly what Upwords is, stacks of fun!

Re-Implements:


Upwords

59604.name: Mythos of the Divine and Worldly
59604.description:
User summary

Mythos of the Divine and Worldly is the second book of the Kingdoms of Kalamar box, available separately in a loose color cover.


From the back of the book

The Kingdoms of Kalamar volume II. This 88 page guidebook painstaikingly describes the 44 deities and religions of Tellene. From the Eternal Lantern to the Rotlord, Mythos of the Divine and Worldly describes each deity's priesthood including holy symbols; weapons, armor & raiment permitted; extra powers and spells; ability restrictions, holy days; advancement; hierarchy and church politics; and more. This text also includes descruiptions of Tellene's major secret organizations, details on the 13 major languages (including 11 rune sets), constellations, astronomical marvels and phenomena and an all-inclusive eight page index.

59606.name: Merchant Prince
59606.description:

59608.description:
User summary

Street Fighter is a solitaire car combat adventure including a special vehicle combat system and cardstock counters.


From the back of the book

Your fare has just led you into the no-man's land of the Old City and pulled an Uzi submachine gun on you. Even if the overpower him, you will be alone and lost among the dangers of the Old City.

Street Fighter is an Autoventures solo module. It can be used with any auto-combat game, including Car Wars, Highway 2000, Battlecars or the Quick Combat System, included. Street Fighter includes: a 32-page booklet, 14 colorful vehicles and a road section.

59609.name: Deluxe Hero Wars
rpgissuearticle: We All Live in a Brass Submarine

Inside This Box Three Complete Books!


Hero Wars - Complete game rule book for players.



Narrator's Book - Advanced rules, hints for gamemaster, creatures, and other Narrator aids.



Gloranthan Visions - Fiction and Mythology of the Heroic Worlds.



Starting Rules Synopsis - Core rules summaries and all of the important tables needed to play.



Sample Characters - Heroes ready to play. Fill in their names and go.



Map of Dragon Pass - Large map showing the place where the Hero Wars ignite!



Map of Glorantha - The World of the Hero Wars.

59610.name: Farb-Klick
59610.description:
The game board is a 6x6 grid. The object is to move all six playing pieces (plastic sticks in six colors for each player) to the other side of the board.
The board itself contains six rows which can change color, courtesy of a handle on either side of the board that can be turned to display new colors. A piece can move in a straight line (as fas as desired, as long as it is only moving over fields of its own color). The first player to reach the other side with all six pieces is the winner.

59612.description:
Special Call of Cthulhu Module Inside!

User comment:

The last issue published by Chaosium

59613.description:
HELL FROM ABOVE: The RAF Descends on Dumenko's Tsaritsyn Offensive, 1919

For a brief moment of time, the Red Army posed a serious threat to Tsaritsyn when the Dumenko Horse Corps had slipped through a large gap in the patchy front lines between the White Caucasian and Don Armies near the Don river. This large gap allowed Dumenko’s three cavalry brigades and a few armor cars to advance unopposed by any White forces. It was only 40 miles from Tsaritsyn. The steppe was perfect for such an advance, flat as hell, providing no cover but fast transit for the cavalry. While White forces did occupy some of Tsaritsyn, there were none in the White rear areas. The closest forces were the 2nd Kuban Cavalry Corps (6000 men) but over a day away. The British B Flight of the 47th RAF led by Lt. Kinkead appeared overhead with Camel fighters and a few DH 9A bombers, swooping down on its prey, firing machines guns and dropping bombs on their strafing runs. This continued for hours. Could a few aircraft actually stop them?

The steppe was perfect for such an advance, flat as hell, providing no cover but fast transit for the cavalry. While White forces did occupy some of Tsaritsyn, there were none in the White rear areas. The closest forces were the 2nd Kuban Cavalry Corps (6000 men) but over a day away. The British B Flight of the 47th RAF led by Lt. Kinkead appeared overhead with Camel fighters and a few DH 9A bombers, swooping down on its prey, firing machines guns and dropping bombs on their strafing runs. This continued for hours. Dumenko's men became scattered, disorganized and sought to escape the HELL FROM ABOVE, saving the city from falling into the Red grasp!

The game comes with a 11x17" map, 280 counters, rules. The map scale is about 800 yd. per hex. Each combat unit is a company. A game turn is 15 minutes of time. Each aircraft is one airplane.
59613.name: Hell from Above

59614.name: The Road to Victory: A War Game
59614.description:
A game for 2 to 4 players. The players roll the die and move around the map following the instructions on the points. There are different routes and a roll of 6 causes the player to go backwards. The first player to get to Berlin and "Sentence the Nazi Leaders" is the winner.

Looks to have been produced just after the invasion of Poland since Denmark, Holland and Belgium have not fallen. In fact the game talks about Romania joining the Allies and features the Polish Submarine Orzel which escaped to England in 1939.

59615.name: Rustlers of the Night
59615.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Burrowing, climbing, flying and crawling come a horde of over 100 ravenous creatures eager to charge into any HackMaster campaign!

This special Hacklopedia PDF compiles all the monsters from the pages of the Knights of the Dinner Table magazine issues #58-120 and KoDT Illustrated #12, as well as many creatures from previously published HackMaster adventure modules! That's right, these monsters have never been available in a single collection until now!

Among other features, readers learn about monster social structures, activity cycles, diets, attack modes (including special attacks), morale, and even how to make the most of their kills by salvaging potentially valuable monster remains.

With today's quick march of events and rapidity of new discoveries, the expansion of human activity and the additions of arcane learning demand that you not miss out on this exciting tome! Check it out now!

59616.name: Aldriv's Revenge
59616.description:
Publisher Blurb:

A 1st to 3rd level module set in the Kingdoms of Kalamar, this adventure supplement is an official third edition Dungeons and Dragons product. Duke Aldriv III has been murdered and his brother, Prince Cardor, has disappeared. Prince Cardor’s son, Mordeln, believes he, himself, may be the assassin’s next target. Let your player’s imaginations come alive as they join forces with Mordeln in his desperate race to find his missing father. Can your player’s find the Prince before the assassins do? This accessory provides characters with a chance for every type of adventure: town, wilderness and dungeon. This adventure contains encounter tables, a complete village, a timeline of events, player handout maps and more.

59617.name: Bomber Greifen an!
59617.description:
Bombers Attack!

The map is of two opposing forces with a "Neutral Zone" in between. The units include bombers, fighters and artillery (including a long range artillery).

The goal of the game is to score Seven hits on the enemy city. Battles can occur between fighters, and bombers as well as air to ground.

It seems to be one in a series that includes Stukas Greifen an and Flieger Greifen an.

Based on the Biplanes it appears to be a product of the 1930s.

59618.description: This Hungarian ccg is based on a series of fantasy novels, which use elements of Hungarian folk-tales. Players are leaders of a team of magicians (one type of cards in the deck), fighting for glory. Magicians you have played can duel. If you don't have any magicians who could fight, you lose a glory point, if no glory point remains, you lose the game.
59618.name: Álomfogók

59619.name: Bad Medicine for Dr. Drugs
59619.description:
From the book

Teenage Superheroes Tackle the Syndicate!

Dr. Drugs had a nice retail outlet at Warren G. Harding High School, and his pills, poppers, and nastier substances went at bargain prices to the Doctor, who dreamed of turning-on all of humanity to the way of drugs, profit was inconsequential (though his syndicate backers hardly thought so).

But, after a student-customer overdoses and dies, the Doctor gets some bad medicine too, when a band of teenage superheroes attending Harding vows to end forever such despicable trafficking.

Bad Medicine for Dr. Drugs is a campaign of four episodes, intended for SUPERWORLD and CHAMPIONS players. Notes outlining the building of original teenage superheroes , though pre-generated player-characters are also provided ready-to-play. Reproduction of high school atmosphere (including the Unwritten Code of behavior) is stressed, as is the presentation of awkward, not fully-mature, fledgling defenders of freedom.

59620.name: The Fate of Heroes
59620.description:
Publisher Blurb:

For 5th-6th-level Characters

In the world of Tellene, Pagari the Fate Scribe is the mighty goddess of prophesy, time and fate. Over the years, the Prophets, as her clergy is called, have built temples and churches throughout Tellene. One such sanctuary in the Kakidela Mountains is rumored to hold dangerous secrets in the catacombs below. Now the reclusive clerics appear to be abducting innocent people. Can the PCs find out what is going on there and will they be the ones to fulfill the Fate of Heroes?

59621.name: Fallen From Grace
59621.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Know this, cleric of light! Your past has come back to torment you. With courage and an unshakable faith, you must confront your personal demons. Danger lurks around every corner. The shattered skeleton warrior beneath your feet is but a taste of the challenge that looms before you. The path will be treacherous and the enemies unrelenting.

Do you possess the courage and conviction to defend your faith and save your soul from eternal torment? Only a quest to recover a sacred relic can prove your worth and purge the evil from one who has Fallen From Grace.

Fortunately, if you take the wrong path, you can always play again. Even after you complete a game, feel free to try again because this book has more than one ending! Some endings are good, and some endings are bad. If you come to a bad end, simply play again from the beginning!

59622.name: Sorcerer's Apprentice (Issue 12 - Fall 1981)

Articles
